Mountain_View.Hanna\u2013Honeycomb House:
The Hanna–Honeycomb House, also known as simply the Hanna House, located on the Stanford University campus in Stanford, California, United States, was Frank Lloyd Wright's first work in the Bay Area and his first work with non-rectangular structures. The house is recognized as a National Historic Landmark.


== Design ==
Begun in 1937 and expanded over 25 years, this is the first and best example of Wright's innovative hexagonal design.
